extraction_metadata.notes: Trial contains extensive witness testimony with detailed accounts of alleged harms spanning 14 years. Strong focus on animal deaths and illnesses, as well as nighttime strangling attacks. Multiple members of the Girard family testified. Accused confessed under torture (thumbscrews) to killing husband, baby, nephew, and multiple animals. Also confessed to attending sabbat 3 times per year and making arrangements to attend less frequently by giving annual gifts of hens or meat. Economic status assessed as middling based on evidence of owning animals (cows, lambs, foal) and employing servants. Practiced healing evidenced by curing foal with flour. Trial ended with execution after Change de Nancy approved death sentence with modification to 'feel fire sharply before being strangled'.
